page.title: 19Food
page.content: Most small food shops have died out leaving supermarkets to supply most people, with the exception of small health food shops, which have opened to meet the growing demand for whole foods, without the additives which are found in modern processed foods. These additives are thought to cause many health problems. A whole new range of convenience foods are available, instant soups, puddings, and complete meals, that only need the addition of milk or water before cooking. Also many other foods that are quick to cook e.g. fish fingers and beefburgers are popular, only needing the minimum cooking times. There are many labour saving gadgets available,gas, electric and microwave cookers, the latter cook in minutes instead of hours. There are also electric mixers and liquidisers for cakes and sauces.
